videoSnippet.title: Garry Kasparov vs Mario Kovač - A London System in Croatia
videoSnippet.description:
#agadmator Get more info and watch the full video of the simul here http://kcfadriatic.com/en/kasparov-in-zagreb/

On Wednesday, December 28, the traditional simultaneous exhibition of one of the best chess players of all time Garry Kasparov was held at the Westin Hotel in Zagreb with prominent public life personalities and with promising chess players.

And again, Kasparov promotes the Chess Club e4 project Chess with school: www.sah-uz-skolu.org
The project has more than 1,500 registered users on the Internet chess platform, and cooperates with 120 primary schools and about 100 chess teachers.
The day before, Youth Chess Festival was held, in which about 120 participants from participants from three countries were participating. 9 and 11 year old winners have qualified to participate in the simultaneous exhibition.
The organizer is the newly established  Kasparov Adriatic Foundation from Zagreb, which has the aim to expand activities in the region. Foundation KCFA is active on five continents and excites thousands of young people through workshops, tournaments and books.

Garry Kasparov vs Mario Kovač
Simultaneous exhibition, 2017, DEC-28 
Queen's Pawn Opening (D00)

1. d4 d5 2. Bf4 Nf6 3. e3 e6 4. Bd3 Nc6 5. Nf3 Bd6 6. Nbd2 O-O 7. c3 Re8 8. Ne5 Be7 9. Qf3 Nxe5 10. dxe5 Nd7 11. h4 c6 12. Qh5 h6 13. Bxh6 Nxe5 14. Qxe5 Bf6 15. Qg3 Kf8 16. Bg5 Bxg5 17. hxg5 g6 18. Qe5 Ke7 19. Rh7 Rf8 20. O-O-O Bd7 21. Nf3 Rc8 22. Bxg6 Rg8 23. Rxf7+ Ke8 24. Rg7+ Kf8 25. Qf4+ Qf6 26. Qxf6#

judgment.name: Inaccuracy
judgment.comment: Checkmate is now unavoidable. Be8 was best.
